TopicTitle: [Question] Is the SAS always gonna act this way? or is it just a placeholder

Articles.Content:
Im sure you all know that the SAS can be pretty jittery.

Im not sure if i remember corectly but i beleiveit was said that it was just a temporary thing right? (not sure)

So will they work on the SAS system in the future? At my attempt at making a cinematic KSP film, I found the fast and sudden movements rather...unsighlty :-X
To the best of my knowledge, its a placeholder we\'ll have to wait for the overhaul
Until/if they are improved, you might want to look into mechjeb till then...

Until/if they are improved, you might want to look into mechjeb till then...

Of course i use mechjeb.

But mechjeb also has the jerky movement since it does use the same system as the SAS doesnt it?

SAS is placeholder for when the kerbals take control. Yes, those little green guys will have to actually do some work soon.

How you can look at it is you are mission control, able to take over flight operations. Otherwise it will be left up to the kerbals to fly the craft per a mission plan. How well they do will depend on their experience and skill which I imagine will change with each successful mission or successful failure. Complete failures would most likely mean the kerbals would be killed and therefore out of the picture.

I look at it at how nice it will be when those bulky ASAS and SAS modules are no longer necessary.

I\'m sure you all know that the SAS can be pretty jittery.

The jitter can be reduced by messing with the Ki/Kp/Kd values in the part\'s CFG file. Making a copy first is probably a good idea.
